parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (11240040), which is a strong indicator of electoral propaganda, as it's a common identifier used by candidates in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions and promotes "Partidul România în Acțiune" (PRA), identifying it by name.  Elena Condei, the candidate, is also implicitly referenced through the page name and the provided CMF number. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, the content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of hashtags further amplifies this reach, targeting potential voters in Giurgiu County and beyond. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support PRA, specifically mentioning their position on the ballot (11th). Phrases like "Votați pentru integritate!", "Alegeți pe cei care vă ascultă și vă reprezintă cu adevărat!", and "Votați Partidul România în Acțiune!" directly aim to influence voting behavior. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks journalistic objectivity. It's not presenting balanced information or different perspectives. Instead, it's a clear advocacy piece promoting a specific party and candidate.  It does not adhere to journalistic standards.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content transcends personal opinion; it's a direct call to action urging voters to support a particular party. While it uses emotionally charged language, it's not simply expressing an opinion but actively campaigning.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3263257220484128</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post strongly suggests electoral propaganda.  The presence of a CMF number, explicit promotion of PRA, direct calls to vote for the party, and the targeted advertising campaign all point towards a violation. The post's content goes beyond informing the public; it actively seeks to influence voting behavior. While the post encourages voting in general, it does so specifically for PRA, making it electoral propaganda. The argument that it's simply encouraging civic duty is weak given the explicit promotion of a specific party.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Elena Condei</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PRA</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Kuantero SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 3263257220484128) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează explicit Partidul România în Acțiune (PRA), candidata Elena Condei (CMF: 11240040), și îndeamnă la vot pentru acest partid, folosind fraze precum "Votați Partidul România în Acțiune!", "Votați pentru integritate!", și "Alegeți pe cei care vă ascultă și vă reprezintă cu adevărat!".  Postarea, cu o cheltuială de 500-599 RON, a atins 35.000-40.000 de impresii, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea PRA.  Contactul advertiserului este contact@condeielena.ro și +40770745585.  Această postare constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie, conform articolului 98 t).
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
